DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date and time that the acquisition of data that resulted in this image started.  Required if Modality (0008,0060) = IVUS May be present otherwise.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/22/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  5/20/07-2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 3

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DT:  DICOM Date Time; The Date Time common data type.  Indicates a concatenated date-time ASCII string in the format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.FFFFFF&ZZZZ The components of this string, from left to right, are YYYY = Year, MM = Month, DD = Day, HH = Hour, MM = Minute, SS = Second, FFFFFF = Fractional Second, and ZZZZ = Hours and Minutes of offset.  &ZZZZ is an optional suffix for plus/minus offset from Coordinated Universal Time.  Valid characters are "0"-"9", "+", "-", "." of Default Character Repertoire.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A comprehensive set of standards for communications between medical imaging devices, including handling, storing and transmitting information in medical imaging. It includes a file format definition and a network communication protocol.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 11/12/10 - CDE part of AIMv1.0 recommended for retirement but used in NCIAv3.0 which is released; removed reference to AIMv1.0 CSI.  8/26/09 - updated short name, released CDE for NBIA load.  6/24/07 -CDE updated to support DICOM CDE IE - DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.
